#EMAPresser

#Novavax vaccine is easier to handle, as it can be stored at normal fridge temperatures. This vaccine will deliver very large amount of doses, up to 1 billion/year, to the #COVAX programme. This will help ensuring that the world is vaccinated as soon as possible. #EMAPresser

The #pandemic hasn't affected EMA's priority areas. This year we have recommended 9âƒ£2âƒ£ medicines ğŸ’Š for approval. #EMAPresser
#Omicron: We will not have to start from scratch with updated vaccine composition because what we might need will not necessarily be very different from the existing #COVID19vaccines. #EMAPresser

#Omicron: There is no answer yet on whether we will need an adapted vaccine with a different composition. The scientific community needs to see more data on the impact of the variant on the effectiveness of the approved vaccines. #EMAPresser
We now have 6âƒ£ treatments for COVID-19 in the ğŸ‡ªğŸ‡º. Every single one is an important addition to our toolbox against #COVID19 and gives hope and possibility to #patients. #EMAPresser

#Boosters are important. Studies show that the use of two different #COVID19vaccines for initial courses and boosters confers, in some cases, even more protection as when the same vaccine is used. #EMAPresser

Vaccines protect from death & hospitalisation. The priority now must be to increase vaccine uptake, increase booster uptake and continue to increase supply â€¼ï¸
We now have 5 vaccines against #COVID19 authorised in the ğŸ‡ªğŸ‡º. 4 more vaccines are under rolling review. #EMAPresser

Xevudy, an antiviral monoclonal antibody, will be considered by our human medicines committee next week for the treatment of #COVID19 #patients who do not require additional oxygen and who are at increased risk of disease progression. #EMAPresser

#Novavaxâ€™s COVID-19 vaccine: We could possibly conclude its evaluation before the end of the year. When authorised, this vaccine will provide a new option for vaccinating people in the EU and globally.
#EMAPresser #COVID19vaccines

Safety of #COVID19vaccines continues to be supported by their large-scale use worldwide. This is the largest vaccination campaign ever, with more than 6âƒ£0âƒ£0âƒ£ million doses administered in the ğŸ‡ªğŸ‡º. #EMAPresser

Epidemiological data show that infections & hospitalisation of children aged 5-11 years have been on the rise in recent months. While children at risk of severe #COVID19 should be given priority, all children in this age group should be considered for vaccination. #EMAPresser

Pfizer/BioNTech #COVID19vaccines in children aged 5-11 years: Safety data are reassuring. So far, no safety concerns have emerged from large vaccination campaigns in this group in the ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¸. #EMAPresser

Current recommendation is to administer #boosters preferably after 6âƒ£ months. Available data support safe and effective administration of a booster dose as early as 3âƒ£ months from completion of primary vaccination. #EMAPresser

Studies show that the combination of vector viral vaccines followed by mRNA vaccines produces high levels of antibodies against #coronavirus when used either as primary vaccination or as a #booster. #EMApresser

EMA has been working with vaccines manufacturers on contingency plans to define requirements for advancing potential variant vaccines. It is too early to say whether the vaccine composition will need to be changed. #EMAPresser

The companies that market #COVID19vaccines are required to submit the results of laboratory tests to determine the level of neutralisation for #Omicron. 
We are prepared to take rapid action when needed. #EMAPresser

At this stage, we do not have enough data on the impact of #OmicronVariant on the effectiveness of the approved #COVID19vaccines but we are continuously scanning the horizon to gather evidence. #EMAPresser

#DeltaVariant should remain the main concern. We are reiterating a call to all citizens to complete their primary #COVID19 vaccination and, for those who are eligible, to get a booster shot. #EMAPresser

text:
Did you miss the 4th EMA public meeting on #COVID19vaccines and #COVID19treatments? You can watch it on EMA's YouTube channel: https://t.co/6ZZlgqpsCW

#EMAPublicMeeting4

#EMAPublicMeeting4

#EMAPublicMeeting4

#COVID19Vaccines have reduced the impact of the virus and remain the key tools to combat the #pandemic. 

Please get vaccinated! For those who are eligible, please get a booster shot! 

 #EMAPublicMeeting4

It is vital that we continue to get vaccinated, especially in those Member States with unacceptably low vaccination rates. Countries should continuously strive to increase their #COVID19 vaccination coverage in all eligible age groups. #EMAPublicMeeting4 
https://t.co/OspLZNSIcR

Depending on the local epidemiological and #COVID19 vaccination coverage situation, #PublicHealth measures (non-pharmaceutical interventions ğŸ˜·) are still needed. 

#EMAPublicMeeting4 @ECDC_EU 
https://t.co/bOowmEsihM

Your feedback on possible #SideEffects helps us all identify risks and find the best measures to mitigate them. 

Get involved and support us in monitoring the #safety of #COVID19vaccines! 

#EMAPublicMeeting4

Like all #medicines, #COVID19vaccines can cause #SideEffects. 

The majority are mild and many people will not experience any at all. 

Serious side effects are very rare and must be balanced against the prevention of severe #COVID19. 

#EMAPublicMeeting4
This is the largest #vaccination campaign ever with over 550 million doses administered in the EU/EEA and the safety profile of the #COVID19vaccines is very reassuring #EMAPublicMeeting4

Numbers of unvaccinated but also some vaccinated patients in hospitals are on the rise in almost all ğŸ‡ªğŸ‡ºMember States. Full #COVID19 vaccination & #boosters are key to staying protected. Get vaccinated & follow advice in your country to keep infection rates low! #EMAPublicMeeting4

https://t.co/YZCZKoHur0

All currently approved #COVID19vaccines ğŸ’‰remain effective against severe disease and death from #COVID19. 

To maintain effectiveness over time people may need to extend their protection with a booster at least 6 months after the second dose. #EMAPublicMeeting4
The #COVID19pandemic is not over yet, but Europe now has more tools to fight it than we had last winter: 4âƒ£ #COVID19vaccines & 3âƒ£ #COVID19treatments authorised in the EU. #EMAPublicMeeting4

The Flu Awareness Week 2021 takes place on ğŸ—“ï¸18 - 22 Oct. 
We encourage everybody who is offered a flu vaccine to get the shot to protect themselves, their family, friends and colleagues. Data show that flu vaccines can be co-administered with #COVID19vaccines. #EMAPresser
EMA has been in constant dialogue with the developer of the oral antiviral #Molnupiravir. We expect the start of the EMA #RollingReview for this #COVID19treatment next week. #EMAPresser
â€¼ï¸ With a death toll of nearly 5âƒ£ million people worldwide, the human cost of natural immunity, when the virus is allowed to run wild, is not tolerable. #EMAPresser

Studies showed that receiving a vaccine after recovering from #COVID19:
â¡ï¸increased people's ability to fight future infections â¡ï¸better protected people from any new infection with coronavirus. #EMAPresser
The conditional marketing authorisation for #Comirnaty was renewed for 1 year by the @EU_Commission based on EMAâ€™s recommendation. #EMAPresser

Increasing the capacity of manufacturing sites enabled the EU to deliver more than 7âƒ£0âƒ£0âƒ£million doses of #COVID19vaccines to the European people, and export over 1âƒ£ billion doses to the rest of the world, to more than 1âƒ£5âƒ£0âƒ£ countries. #EMAPresser
Having a range of different technological platforms for #COVID19vaccines remains important in the fight against the #COVID19pandemic and to tackle future #pandemics. #EMAPresser

We are seeing promising results from studies confirming a stronger immune response when the #COVID19vaccine given as a 2nd or 3rd dose is different to the vaccine that was initially received. We continue to collect and look into data on heterologous vaccination. #EMAPresser
Over the coming weeks, we will receive data on the #Janssen booster given 6 months after the 1st dose. #EMAPresser
An EMA conclusion on a booster dose of #Spikevax in people over 12 years of age, 6 months after the second dose, is expected on 25 October. We will communicate the outcome. #EMAPresser

We are seeing data on the use of #Spikevax, the #COVID19vaccine developed by Moderna, in young children. We are discussing timelines of application with the developer to extend the use of this vaccine to children in the future. #EMAPresser

EMA started evaluating a marketing authorisation application for Regkirona (regdanvimab) to treat adults with #COVID19 who do not require additional oxygen therapy and who are at increased risk of progressing to severe COVID-19. #EMAPresser https://t.co/YCnDdXvLkE
We remind everyone that EMA is closely monitoring and assessing any reports of suspected #SideEffects with #COVID19vaccines. #EMAPresser
Marketing authorisation holders for the other #COVID19vaccines approved in the ğŸ‡ªğŸ‡º have also submitted their annual renewal application. These assessments are currently ongoing. #EMAPresser

The annual renewal of conditional marketing authorisations is a standard process and it is on track for all #COVID19vaccines. The conditional marketing authorisation for #Spikevax has been renewed for one year by @EU_Commission based on EMAâ€™s recommendation. #EMAPresser

Some EU countries have already started administering booster doses. â€¼ï¸ Implementation of #COVID19 vaccination campaigns in the ğŸ‡ªğŸ‡º remains the prerogative of the public health authorities guiding the vaccination campaigns in each Member State. #EMAPresser

What we know for now: When administered in 2 doses, #COVID19vaccines protect against hospitalisation and death from #COVID19. We monitor this very carefully together with @ECDC_EU, so that we can spot trends and update guidance. #EMAPresser

EMA is also currently evaluating an application for the use of a #boosterdose of #Spikevax to be given at least 6 months after the 2nd dose in people aged 12 years and older. EMA will communicate the outcome of the assessment. #EMAPresser

#Myocarditis is the main safety concern emerging with mRNA vaccines, especially after the 2nd dose. 
â€¼ï¸ Most of the myocarditis cases reported are mild and self-limiting. 
We cannot yet characterise this risk after a 3rd dose because it occurs so rarely. #EMAPresser

EMA conclusion: #Comirnaty #boosterdose is safe & effective, as data show a rise in antibody levels when giving a booster approx. 6 months after the 2nd dose in people aged 18 to 55. 
Currently we cannot firmly recommend when & for whom to implement booster doses. #EMAPresser
â€¼ï¸ It is important to distinguish between 3rd doses for people with severely weakened immune systems and #boosterdoses for the general population. #EMAPresser

Based on limited data available, the use of a 3rd dose is restricted to severely immunocompromised patients. There is no clear evidence that less immunocompromised patients would benefit from a 3d dose as part of the primary vaccination series. #EMAPresser
The EMA conclusion for both vaccines is based on studies in patients with severely weakened immune systems because of use of immunosuppressive drugs after an organ transplant. #EMAPresser
EMA concluded that 3rd doses of #Comirnaty and #Spikevax may be given to people with severely weakened immune systems aged 12 or older, at least 28 days after their second dose. #EMAPresser
